title: Head of a Woman
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Attributed to Angelica Kauffmann [1740-1807]. Eliot, Inc. Boston, MA, until 1955; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA, 1955 until April 1967 [1]; their gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, April 1967 [2].

Notes:
[1]. Purchased in 1955 from Eliot Inc. on Newbury Street, Boston for $55 (see curatorial file for Mrs. Beal's note on a list dated March 1, 1966.)
[2]. The drawing was in storage at the museum since before March 1966. It was accessioned on April 11, 1967.
